description: This Python source file defines a class 'GoogleMapTools' that provides various utilities for interacting with Google Maps APIs, including searching places, getting directions, address validation, geocoding, reverse geocoding, distance matrix, elevation, and timezone information. It leverages the 'googlemaps' client library and integrates with the 'Toolkit' base class.

classes.name: GoogleMapTools
classes.description: A toolkit class providing methods to interact with Google Maps APIs for searching places, directions, address validation, geocoding, reverse geocoding, distance matrix, elevation, and timezone.

methods.name: search_places
methods.description: Searches for places using Google Maps Places API based on a query string, returning detailed information about each place.

methods.name: get_directions
methods.description: Retrieves directions between an origin and a destination using Google Maps Directions API.

methods.name: validate_address
methods.description: Validates an address using Google Maps Address Validation API.

methods.name: geocode_address
methods.description: Converts an address into geographic coordinates using Google Maps Geocoding API.

methods.name: reverse_geocode
methods.description: Converts geographic coordinates into an address using Google Maps Reverse Geocoding API.

methods.name: get_distance_matrix
methods.description: Calculates distance and travel time between multiple origins and destinations.

methods.name: get_elevation
methods.description: Retrieves elevation data for a specific geographic location.

methods.name: get_timezone
methods.description: Retrieves timezone information for a specific geographic location.
